title: Rudgwick Walks Walking Route

images.title: The Fox Inn, Rudgwick by Peter Holmes, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Fox Inn, Rudgwick

images.title: Colin Smith / Pond by Hyes Farm
images.caption: Pond by Hyes Farm Possibly a remnant from the days of workhorses on farms - or is it ornamental? The duck island is certainly ornamental - is it a recently purchased "Stockholm Duck Island"?!

images.title: Colin Smith / Furnace Lakes
images.caption: Furnace Lakes. Modern carp fishery using former furnace ponds from a medieval Wealden iron-making industry.

images.title: Rudgwick church by Robin Webster, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Rudgwick church. The Church of England parish church of the Holy Trinity has a 12th-century Norman font of Sussex Marble. The belltower is early 13th century.The church was largely rebuilt in the 14th century, when the north aisle was added and probably the present chancel was built.

images.title: Old pigsties, Rudgwick by Robin Webster, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Old pigsties, Rudgwick

images.title: River Arun near Rudgwick Grange by Robin Webster, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: River Arun near Rudgwick Grange

images.title: Footpath 1396, Rudgwick by Robin Webster, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Footpath 1396 near the village.

images.title: The Downs Link, Rudgwick by N Chadwick, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Downs Link, Rudgwick

description: This walk explores the countryside around the West Sussex village of Rudgwick. The village is located just west of Horsham in the Low Weald, near to the border with Surrey. Rudgwick includes a noteworthy 14th century church and a fine 16th century pub to relax in after your exercise. Two waymarked footpaths pass the village in the shape of the Downs Link and the Sussex Border Path. These waymarked trails are a good way of exploring the area on foot. This walk from the village takes you east through the fields towards the pretty Furnace Lakes. On the way there's lots of woodland trails and fine countryside views to enjoy.
